header.title: Settings
header.doneButtonTooltip: Discard unsaved changes and close settings panel

unsavedChangesDialog.title: Unsaved Changes
unsavedChangesDialog.description: Do you want to discard changes and continue?

contact.label: Need to talk to us? Write

about.community: Want tips or to just hang out with other Roo Code users? Join <redditLink>reddit.com/r/RooCode</redditLink> or <discordLink>discord.gg/roocode</discordLink>

slashCommands.description: Manage your slash commands to quickly execute custom workflows and actions. <DocsLink>Learn more</DocsLink>

collapseThinking.label: Collapse Thinking messages by default
collapseThinking.description: When enabled, thinking blocks will be collapsed by default until you interact with them

requireCtrlEnterToSend.label: Require {{primaryMod}}+Enter to send messages
requireCtrlEnterToSend.description: When enabled, you must press {{primaryMod}}+Enter to send messages instead of just Enter

prompts.description: Configure support prompts that are used for quick actions like enhancing prompts, explaining code, and fixing issues. These prompts help Roo provide better assistance for common development tasks.

codeIndex.title: Codebase Indexing
codeIndex.description: Configure codebase indexing settings to enable semantic search of your project. <0>Learn more</0>
codeIndex.enableDescription: Enable code indexing for improved search and context understanding
codeIndex.disabledMessage: Codebase indexing is currently disabled. Enable it in the global settings to configure indexing options.
codeIndex.openAiCompatibleModelDimensionDescriptio: The embedding dimension (output size) for your model. Check your provider's documentation for this value. Common values: 384, 768, 1536, 3072.
codeIndex.searchMinScoreDescription: Minimum similarity score (0.0-1.0) required for search results. Lower values return more results but may be less relevant. Higher values return fewer but more relevant results.
codeIndex.searchMaxResultsDescription: Maximum number of search results to return when querying the codebase index. Higher values provide more context but may include less relevant results.
codeIndex.unsavedSettingsMessage: Please save your settings before starting the indexing process.

clearDataDialog.title: Are you sure?
clearDataDialog.description: This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete your codebase index data.

rollbackDialog.title: Rollback Configuration
rollbackDialog.description: Are you sure you want to rollback to the previous configuration?

validation.modelDimensionMinValue: Model dimension must be greater than 0

codeIndex.requireIndexingConfirmationDescription: When enabled, requires user confirmation before starting the indexing process to prevent accidental operations.

vectorStorage.title: Vector Storage Configuration
vectorStorage.modeDescription: Choose how vector storage parameters are configured
vectorStorage.presetDescription: Select a preset configuration optimized for different collection sizes

thresholds.tinyDescription: Maximum number of vectors for tiny collection configuration (default: 2,000)
thresholds.smallDescription: Maximum number of vectors for small collection configuration (default: 10,000)
thresholds.mediumDescription: Maximum number of vectors for medium collection configuration (default: 100,000)

vectorStorage.hnswMDescription: Number of bi-directional links for each node. Higher values improve recall but increase memory usage and build time.
vectorStorage.hnswEfConstructDescription: Size of dynamic candidate list during index construction. Higher values improve index quality but increase build time.

autoApprove.description: Run these actions without asking for permission. Only enable for actions you fully trust and if you understand the security risks.
autoApprove.toggleShortcut: You can configure a keyboard shortcut for this setting <SettingsLink>in your IDE preferences</SettingsLink>.

readOnly.label: Read
readOnly.description: When enabled, Roo will automatically view directory contents and read files without requiring you to click the Approve button.

outsideWorkspace.label: Include files outside workspace
outsideWorkspace.description: Allow Roo to read files outside the current workspace without requiring approval.

write.label: Write
write.description: Automatically create and edit files without requiring approval
write.delayLabel: Delay after writes to allow diagnostics to detect potential problems

outsideWorkspace.label: Include files outside workspace
outsideWorkspace.description: Allow Roo to create and edit files outside the current workspace without requiring approval.

protected.label: Include protected files
protected.description: Allow Roo to create and edit protected files (like .rooignore and .roo/ configuration files) without requiring approval.

browser.label: Browser
browser.description: Automatically perform browser actions without requiring approval. Note: Only applies when the model supports computer use

mcp.label: MCP
mcp.description: Enable auto-approval of individual MCP tools in the MCP Servers view (requires both this setting and the tool's individual "Always allow" checkbox)

modeSwitch.label: Mode
modeSwitch.description: Automatically switch between different modes without requiring approval

subtasks.label: Subtasks
subtasks.description: Allow creation and completion of subtasks without requiring approval

followupQuestions.label: Question
followupQuestions.description: Automatically select the first suggested answer for follow-up questions after the configured timeout
followupQuestions.timeoutLabel: Time to wait before auto-selecting the first answer

execute.label: Execute
execute.description: Automatically execute allowed terminal commands without requiring approval
execute.allowedCommandsDescription: Command prefixes that can be auto-executed when "Always approve execute operations" is enabled. Add * to allow all commands (use with caution).
execute.deniedCommandsDescription: Command prefixes that will be automatically denied without asking for approval. In case of conflicts with allowed commands, the longest prefix match takes precedence. Add * to deny all commands.
execute.autoDenied: Commands with the prefix `{{prefix}}` have been forbidden by the user. Do not bypass this restriction by running another command.

maxLimits.description: Automatically make requests up to these limits before asking for approval to continue.

autoApprove.selectOptionsFirst: Select at least one option below to enable auto-approval

providers.description: Save different API configurations to quickly switch between providers and settings.
providers.nameExists: A profile with this name already exists
providers.invalidArnFormat: Invalid ARN format. Please check the examples above.
providers.apiKeyStorageNotice: API keys are stored securely in VSCode's Secret Storage
providers.noCustomHeaders: No custom headers defined. Click the + button to add one.

refreshModels.label: Refresh Models
refreshModels.hint: Please reopen the settings to see the latest models.
refreshModels.error: Failed to refresh models list. Please try again.

providers.anthropicUseAuthToken: Pass Anthropic API Key as Authorization header instead of X-Api-Key
providers.anthropic1MContextBetaDescription: Extends context window to 1 million tokens for Claude Sonnet 4
providers.enablePromptCachingTitle: Enable prompt caching to improve performance and reduce costs for supported models.
providers.cacheUsageNote: Note: If you don't see cache usage, try selecting a different model and then selecting your desired model again.

urlContext.title: Enable URL context
urlContext.description: Lets Gemini read linked pages to extract, compare, and synthesize their content into informed responses.

groundingSearch.title: Enable Grounding with Google search
groundingSearch.description: Connects Gemini to real‑time web data for accurate, up‑to‑date answers with verifiable citations.

googleCloudSetup.title: To use Google Cloud Vertex AI, you need to:
googleCloudSetup.step1: 1. Create a Google Cloud account, enable the Vertex AI API & enable the desired Claude models.
googleCloudSetup.step2: 2. Install the Google Cloud CLI & configure application default credentials.
googleCloudSetup.step3: 3. Or create a service account with credentials.

humanRelay.description: No API key is required, but the user needs to help copy and paste the information to the web chat AI.
humanRelay.instructions: During use, a dialog box will pop up and the current message will be copied to the clipboard automatically. You need to paste these to web versions of AI (such as ChatGPT or Claude), then copy the AI's reply back to the dialog box and click the confirm button.

customModel.capabilities: Configure the capabilities and pricing for your custom OpenAI-compatible model. Be careful when specifying the model capabilities, as they can affect how Roo Code performs.

maxTokens.label: Max Output Tokens
maxTokens.description: Maximum number of tokens the model can generate in a response. (Specify -1 to allow the server to set the max tokens.)

contextWindow.label: Context Window Size
contextWindow.description: Total tokens (input + output) the model can process.

imageSupport.label: Image Support
imageSupport.description: Is this model capable of processing and understanding images?

computerUse.label: Computer Use
computerUse.description: Is this model capable of interacting with a browser?

promptCache.label: Prompt Caching
promptCache.description: Is this model capable of caching prompts?

input.label: Input Price
input.description: Cost per million tokens in the input/prompt. This affects the cost of sending context and instructions to the model.

output.label: Output Price
output.description: Cost per million tokens in the model's response. This affects the cost of generated content and completions.

cacheReads.label: Cache Reads Price
cacheReads.description: Cost per million tokens for reading from the cache. This is the price charged when a cached response is retrieved.

cacheWrites.label: Cache Writes Price
cacheWrites.description: Cost per million tokens for writing to the cache. This is the price charged when a prompt is cached for the first time.

rateLimitSeconds.label: Rate limit
rateLimitSeconds.description: Minimum time ({{value}} seconds) between API requests.

consecutiveMistakeLimit.label: Error & Repetition Limit
consecutiveMistakeLimit.description: Number of consecutive errors or repeated actions ({{value}}) before showing 'Roo is having trouble' dialog. Set to 0 to disable this safety mechanism (it will never trigger).
consecutiveMistakeLimit.unlimitedDescription: Unlimited retries enabled (auto-proceed). The dialog will never appear.
consecutiveMistakeLimit.warning: ⚠️ Setting to 0 allows unlimited retries which may consume significant API usage

verbosity.label: Output Verbosity
verbosity.description: Controls how detailed the model's responses are. Low verbosity produces concise answers, while high verbosity provides thorough explanations.

claudeCode.description: Optional path to your Claude Code CLI. Defaults to 'claude' if not set.
claudeCode.maxTokensDescription: Maximum number of output tokens for Claude Code responses. Default is 8000.

enable.label: Enable browser tool
enable.description: When enabled, Roo can use a browser to interact with websites when using models that support computer use. <0>Learn more</0>

viewport.label: Viewport size
viewport.description: Select the viewport size for browser interactions. This affects how websites are displayed and interacted with.

screenshotQuality.label: Screenshot quality
screenshotQuality.description: Adjust the WebP quality of browser screenshots. Higher values provide clearer screenshots but increase token usage.

remote.label: Use remote browser connection
remote.description: Connect to a Chrome browser running with remote debugging enabled (--remote-debugging-port=9222).
remote.instructions: Enter the DevTools Protocol host address or leave empty to auto-discover Chrome local instances. The Test Connection button will try the custom URL if provided, or auto-discover if the field is empty.

timeout.label: Checkpoint initialization timeout (seconds)
timeout.description: Maximum time to wait for checkpoint service initialization. Default is 15 seconds. Range: 10-60 seconds.

enable.label: Enable automatic checkpoints
enable.description: When enabled, Roo will automatically create checkpoints during task execution, making it easy to review changes or revert to earlier states. <0>Learn more</0>

terminal.label: Terminal Command Checkpoints
terminal.beforeHighRiskDescription: Automatically create a checkpoint before executing potentially dangerous commands
terminal.afterHighRiskDescription: Automatically create a checkpoint after executing potentially dangerous commands
terminal.onErrorDescription: Create a checkpoint when a terminal command fails or returns an error
terminal.requiredCommandsDescription: Commands that will always trigger a checkpoint before execution
terminal.exemptedCommandsDescription: Commands that will never trigger a checkpoint

sound.label: Enable sound effects
sound.description: When enabled, Roo will play sound effects for notifications and events.

tts.label: Enable text-to-speech
tts.description: When enabled, Roo will read aloud its responses using text-to-speech.

contextManagement.description: Control what information is included in the AI's context window, affecting token usage and response quality

autoCondenseContextPercent.label: Threshold to trigger intelligent context condensing
autoCondenseContextPercent.description: When the context window reaches this threshold, Roo will automatically condense it.

condensingApiConfiguration.label: API Configuration for Context Condensing
condensingApiConfiguration.description: Select which API configuration to use for context condensing operations. Leave unselected to use the current active configuration.

customCondensingPrompt.label: Custom Context Condensing Prompt
customCondensingPrompt.description: Customize the system prompt used for context condensing. Leave empty to use the default prompt.
customCondensingPrompt.placeholder:
Enter your custom condensing prompt here...

You can use the same structure as the default prompt:
- Previous Conversation
- Current Work
- Key Technical Concepts
- Relevant Files and Code
- Problem Solving
- Pending Tasks and Next Steps

autoCondenseContext.name: Automatically trigger intelligent context condensing
autoCondenseContext.description: When enabled, Roo will automatically condense the context when the threshold is reached. When disabled, you can still manually trigger context condensing.

openTabs.label: Open tabs context limit
openTabs.description: Maximum number of VSCode open tabs to include in context. Higher values provide more context but increase token usage.

workspaceFiles.label: Workspace files context limit
workspaceFiles.description: Maximum number of files to include in current working directory details. Higher values provide more context but increase token usage.

rooignore.label: Show .rooignore'd files in lists and searches
rooignore.description: When enabled, files matching patterns in .rooignore will be shown in lists with a lock symbol. When disabled, these files will be completely hidden from file lists and searches.

maxConcurrentFileReads.label: Concurrent file reads limit
maxConcurrentFileReads.description: Maximum number of files the 'read_file' tool can process concurrently. Higher values may speed up reading multiple small files but increase memory usage.

maxReadFile.label: File read auto-truncate threshold
maxReadFile.description: Roo reads this number of lines when the model omits start/end values. If this number is less than the file's total, Roo generates a line number index of code definitions. Special cases: -1 instructs Roo to read the entire file (without indexing), and 0 instructs it to read no lines and provides line indexes only for minimal context. Lower values minimize initial context usage, enabling precise subsequent line-range reads. Explicit start/end requests are not limited by this setting.

maxImageFileSize.label: Max image file size
maxImageFileSize.description: Maximum size (in MB) for image files that can be processed by the read file tool.

maxTotalImageSize.label: Max total image size
maxTotalImageSize.description: Maximum cumulative size limit (in MB) for all images processed in a single read_file operation. When reading multiple images, each image's size is added to the total. If including another image would exceed this limit, it will be skipped.

includeMessages.label: Automatically include diagnostics in context
includeMessages.description: When enabled, diagnostic messages (errors) from edited files will be automatically included in the context. You can always manually include all workspace diagnostics using @problems.

maxMessages.label: Maximum diagnostic messages
maxMessages.description: Limits the number of diagnostic messages (errors, warnings) included in the context. When set, only this many diagnostics will be shown, prioritizing errors over warnings. Set to 0 for unlimited diagnostics.

delayAfterWrite.label: Delay after writes to allow diagnostics to detect potential problems
delayAfterWrite.description: Time to wait after file writes before proceeding, allowing diagnostic tools to process changes and detect issues.

condensingThreshold.label: Condensing Trigger Threshold
condensingThreshold.defaultDescription: When context reaches {{threshold}}%, it will be automatically condensed for all profiles unless they have custom settings
condensingThreshold.profileDescription: Custom threshold for this profile only (overrides global default)
condensingThreshold.inheritDescription: This profile inherits the global default threshold ({{threshold}}%)

includeCurrentTime.label: Include current time in context
includeCurrentTime.description: When enabled, the current time and timezone information will be included in the system prompt. Disable this if models are stopping work due to time concerns.

includeCurrentCost.label: Include current cost in context
includeCurrentCost.description: When enabled, the current API usage cost will be included in the system prompt. Disable this if models are stopping work due to cost concerns.

maxGitStatusFiles.label: Git status max files
maxGitStatusFiles.description: Maximum number of file entries to include in git status context. Set to 0 to disable. Branch info is always shown when > 0.

advanced.label: Terminal Settings: Advanced
advanced.description: These settings apply only when 'Use Inline Terminal' is disabled. They affect the VS Code terminal only and may require restarting the IDE.

outputLineLimit.label: Terminal output limit
outputLineLimit.description: Keeps the first and last lines and drops the middle to stay under the limit. Lower to save tokens; raise to give Roo more middle detail. Roo sees a placeholder where the content is skipped.<0>Learn more</0>

outputCharacterLimit.label: Terminal character limit
outputCharacterLimit.description: Overrides the line limit to prevent memory issues by enforcing a hard cap on output size. If exceeded, keeps the beginning and end and shows a placeholder to Roo where content is skipped. <0>Learn more</0>

shellIntegrationTimeout.label: Terminal shell integration timeout
shellIntegrationTimeout.description: How long to wait for VS Code shell integration before running commands. Raise if your shell starts slowly or you see 'Shell Integration Unavailable' errors. <0>Learn more</0>

shellIntegrationDisabled.label: Use Inline Terminal (recommended)
shellIntegrationDisabled.description: Run commands in the Inline Terminal (chat) to bypass shell profiles/integration for faster, more reliable runs. When disabled Roo uses the VS Code terminal with your shell profile, prompts, and plugins. <0>Learn more</0>

commandDelay.label: Terminal command delay
commandDelay.description: Adds a short pause after each command so the VS Code terminal can flush all output (bash/zsh: PROMPT_COMMAND sleep; PowerShell: start-sleep). Use only if you see missing tail output; otherwise leave at 0. <0>Learn more</0>

compressProgressBar.label: Compress progress bar output
compressProgressBar.description: Collapses progress bars/spinners so only the final state is kept (saves tokens). <0>Learn more</0>

powershellCounter.label: Enable PowerShell counter workaround
powershellCounter.description: Turn this on when PowerShell output is missing or duplicated; it appends a tiny counter to each command to stabilize output. Keep this off if output already looks correct. <0>Learn more</0>

zshClearEolMark.label: Clear ZSH EOL mark
zshClearEolMark.description: Turn this on when you see stray % at the end of lines or parsing looks wrong; it omits Zsh’s end‑of‑line mark (%). <0>Learn more</0>

zshOhMy.label: Enable Oh My Zsh integration
zshOhMy.description: Turn this on when your Oh My Zsh theme/plugins expect shell integration; it sets ITERM_SHELL_INTEGRATION_INSTALLED=Yes. Turn this off to avoid setting that variable. <0>Learn more</0>

zshP10k.label: Enable Powerlevel10k integration
zshP10k.description: Turn this on when using Powerlevel10k shell integration. <0>Learn more</0>

zdotdir.label: Enable ZDOTDIR handling
zdotdir.description: Turn this on when zsh shell integration fails or conflicts with your dotfiles. <0>Learn more</0>

inheritEnv.label: Inherit environment variables
inheritEnv.description: Turn this on to inherit environment variables from the parent VS Code process. <0>Learn more</0>

toolProtocol.label: Tool Call Protocol
toolProtocol.description: Choose how Roo communicates with the API. Native uses the provider's function calling API, while XML uses XML-formatted tool definitions.

diff.label: Enable editing through diffs
diff.description: When enabled, Roo will be able to edit files more quickly and will automatically reject truncated full-file writes

descriptions.standard: Standard diff strategy applies changes to a single code block at a time.
descriptions.unified: Unified diff strategy takes multiple approaches to applying diffs and chooses the best approach.
descriptions.multiBlock: Multi-block diff strategy allows updating multiple code blocks in a file in one request.

matchPrecision.label: Match precision
matchPrecision.description: This slider controls how precisely code sections must match when applying diffs. Lower values allow more flexible matching but increase the risk of incorrect replacements. Use values below 100% with extreme caution.

todoList.label: Enable todo list tool
todoList.description: When enabled, Roo can create and manage todo lists to track task progress. This helps organize complex tasks into manageable steps.

DIFF_STRATEGY_UNIFIED.name: Use experimental unified diff strategy
DIFF_STRATEGY_UNIFIED.description: Enable the experimental unified diff strategy. This strategy might reduce the number of retries caused by model errors but may cause unexpected behavior or incorrect edits. Only enable if you understand the risks and are willing to carefully review all changes.

INSERT_BLOCK.name: Use experimental insert content tool
INSERT_BLOCK.description: Enable the experimental insert content tool, allowing Roo to insert content at specific line numbers without needing to create a diff.

POWER_STEERING.name: Use experimental "power steering" mode
POWER_STEERING.description: When enabled, Roo will remind the model about the details of its current mode definition more frequently. This will lead to stronger adherence to role definitions and custom instructions, but will use more tokens per message.

CONCURRENT_FILE_READS.name: Enable concurrent file reads
CONCURRENT_FILE_READS.description: When enabled, Roo can read multiple files in a single request. When disabled, Roo must read files one at a time. Disabling this can help when working with less capable models or when you want more control over file access.

MULTI_SEARCH_AND_REPLACE.name: Use experimental multi block diff tool
MULTI_SEARCH_AND_REPLACE.description: When enabled, Roo will use multi block diff tool. This will try to update multiple code blocks in the file in one request.

MARKETPLACE.name: Enable Marketplace
MARKETPLACE.description: When enabled, you can install MCPs and custom modes from the Marketplace.

MULTI_FILE_APPLY_DIFF.name: Enable concurrent file edits
MULTI_FILE_APPLY_DIFF.description: When enabled, Roo can edit multiple files in a single request. When disabled, Roo must edit files one at a time. Disabling this can help when working with less capable models or when you want more control over file modifications.

PREVENT_FOCUS_DISRUPTION.name: Background editing
PREVENT_FOCUS_DISRUPTION.description: Prevent editor focus disruption when enabled. File edits happen in the background without opening diff views or stealing focus. You can continue working uninterrupted while Roo makes changes. Files can be opened without focus to capture diagnostics or kept closed entirely.

ASSISTANT_MESSAGE_PARSER.name: Use new message parser
ASSISTANT_MESSAGE_PARSER.description: Enable the experimental streaming message parser that provides significant performance improvements for long assistant responses by processing messages more efficiently.

NEW_TASK_REQUIRE_TODOS.name: Require 'todos' list for new tasks
NEW_TASK_REQUIRE_TODOS.description: When enabled, the new_task tool will require a todos parameter to be provided. This ensures all new tasks start with a clear list of objectives. When disabled (default), the todos parameter remains optional for backward compatibility.

IMAGE_GENERATION.name: Enable AI image generation
IMAGE_GENERATION.description: When enabled, Roo can generate images from text prompts using image generation models.
IMAGE_GENERATION.providerDescription: Select which provider to use for image generation.
IMAGE_GENERATION.modelSelectionDescription: Select the model to use for image generation
IMAGE_GENERATION.successConfigured: ✓ Image generation is configured and ready to use

RUN_SLASH_COMMAND.name: Enable model-initiated slash commands
RUN_SLASH_COMMAND.description: When enabled, Roo can run your slash commands to execute workflows.

MULTIPLE_NATIVE_TOOL_CALLS.name: Parallel tool calls
MULTIPLE_NATIVE_TOOL_CALLS.description: When enabled, the native protocol can execute multiple tools in a single assistant message turn.

promptCaching.label: Disable prompt caching
promptCaching.description: When checked, Roo will not use prompt caching for this model.

temperature.description: Controls randomness in the model's responses.
temperature.rangeDescription: Higher values make output more random, lower values make it more deterministic.

modelInfo.enableR1FormatTips: Must be enabled when using R1 models such as QWQ to prevent 400 errors

gemini.freeRequests: * Free up to {{count}} requests per minute. After that, billing depends on prompt size.
gemini.pricingDetails: For more info, see pricing details.
gemini.billingEstimate: * Billing is an estimate - exact cost depends on prompt size.

modelPicker.automaticFetch: The extension automatically fetches the latest list of models available on <serviceLink>{{serviceName}}</serviceLink>. If you're unsure which model to choose, Roo Code works best with <defaultModelLink>{{defaultModelId}}</defaultModelLink>. You can also try searching "free" for no-cost options currently available.
modelPicker.label: Model
modelPicker.simplifiedExplanation: You can adjust detailed model settings later.

telemetry.label: Allow anonymous error and usage reporting
telemetry.description: Help improve Roo Code by sending anonymous usage data and error reports. This telemetry does not collect code, prompts or personal information. See our <privacyLink>privacy policy</privacyLink> for more details.

validation.apiKey: You must provide a valid API key.
validation.googleCloud: You must provide a valid Google Cloud Project ID and Region.
validation.modelId: You must provide a valid model ID.
validation.modelSelector: You must provide a valid model selector.
validation.openAi: You must provide a valid base URL, API key, and model ID.

arn.invalidFormat: Invalid ARN format. Please check the format requirements.
arn.regionMismatch: Warning: The region in your ARN ({{arnRegion}}) does not match your selected region ({{region}}). This may cause access issues. The provider will use the region from the ARN.

validation.modelAvailability: The model ID ({{modelId}}) you provided is not available. Please choose a different model.
validation.modelDeprecated: This model is no longer available. Please select a different model.
validation.providerNotAllowed: Provider '{{provider}}' is not allowed by your organization
validation.modelNotAllowed: Model '{{model}}' is not allowed for provider '{{provider}}' by your organization
validation.profileInvalid: This profile contains a provider or model that is not allowed by your organization
validation.qwenCodeOauthPath: You must provide a valid OAuth credentials path.

includeMaxOutputTokensDescription: Send max output tokens parameter in API requests. Some providers may not support this.
limitMaxTokensDescription: Limit the maximum number of tokens in the response
maxTokensGenerateDescription: Maximum tokens to generate in response

serviceTier.label: Service tier
serviceTier.tooltip: For faster processing of API requests, try the priority processing service tier. For lower prices with higher latency, try the flex processing tier.
serviceTier.pricingTableTitle: Pricing by service tier (price per 1M tokens)
